Class.name: MDX2JSON.REST
Class.Description:
Class for REST-like web api for MDX2JSON transformation (and XML/A).
Example: send HTTP POST request to web application with Dispatch class MDX2JSON.REST with body: { "MDX":"QUERY" }, where QUERY is a correct MDX statement, ex:
{
"MDX": "SELECT NON EMPTY [Product].[P1].[Product Category].Members ON 0,NON EMPTY [Outlet].[H1].[Region].Members ON 1 FROM [HoleFoods]"
}
You can send requests to:
  • webapplication/Test - to get test info, %request, %response and %session
  • webapplication/MDX - to get result in JSON format for MDX query
  • webapplication/MDXDrillthrough - to get resulting listing in JSON format for MDX Drillthrough query
  • webapplication/MDX2XMLA - to get result in XML/A format for MDX query
Dashboard related requests are:
  • webapplication/Dashboards - get all dashboards in a namespace (GET request).
  • webapplication/Widgets - get all dashboard widgets (POST request with {Dashboard:"DashboardName"} body).
To get information about possible Cube's filters and filters' values:
  • webapplication/FilterValues/:cube - to get all filters for DeepSee Cube in JSON format.
  • webapplication/FilterValues/:cube - Same but with POST { "Cube":"CubeName","Values":0} body. If values = 1, then filters' values would also be provided.
  • webapplication/FilterValues/:cube/:filter - to get all values for Filter for DeepSee Cube in JSON format.
Example: send HTTP GET request to web application with Dispatch class MDX2JSON.REST and URL:
/FilterValues/HoleFoods/[DateOfSale].[Actual].[MonthSold] - to get information about possible values of [DateOfSale].[Actual].[MonthSold] in HoleFoods Cube.
To get information about pivot:
  • webapplication/DataSource- to get info about pivot (POST {DataSource:"Name of DS"})
You can add a param Namespace to request to execute MDX in desired namespace (MDX2JSON package must be mapped to that namespace):
webapplication/MDX?Namespace=Samples

XData.name: UrlMap
XData.Data:
<Routes> <!-- Send objects in this format: {"MDX":"QUERY"} HTTP method: POST --> <Route Url="/MDX" Method="POST" Call="WriteJSONfromMDX" Body="MDX"/> <Route Url="/MDX2JSONP" Method="POST" Call="WriteJSONPfromMDX" Body="MDX"/> <Route Url="/MDXDrillthrough" Method="POST" Call="WriteDrillthroughJSON" Body="MDX"/> <Route Url="/MDX2XMLA" Method="POST" Call="WriteXMLAfromMDX" Body="MDX"/>
<!-- Get info about availible filters and their values --> <Route Url="/FilterValues/:cube" Method="GET" Call="WriteFiltersForCube"/> <Route Url="/FilterValues" Method="POST" Call="WriteFilterValuesForCube" Body="Cube"/> <Route Url="/FilterValues/:cube/:filter" Method="GET" Call="WriteFilterValues"/>
<!-- Get info about widgets--> <Route Url="/Dashboards" Method="GET" Call="GetDashboardList"/> <Route Url="/Widgets" Method="POST" Call="GetWidgetsList" Body="Dashboard"/>
<!-- Get info about pivot--> <Route Url="/DataSource" Method="POST" Call="GetDataSource" Body="DataSource"/>
<!-- Valid but illicit, do not use--> <Route Url="/MDX/:query" Method="GET" Call="WriteJSONfromMDXURL"/> <Route Url="/MDXfilters/:query" Method="GET" Call="WriteFiltersForMDX"/>
<!-- Test method--> <Route Url="/Test" Method="GET" Call="Test"/> </Routes>

Method.name: ValidateRequest
Method.Description:
Validates incoming request body against Body Route attribute.
Converts request body into UTF8 proxyObject.

Method.name: GetWidgetsList
Method.Description:
Wrapper for ##class(MDX2JSON.Utils).GetWidgetsList()
Converts incoming request object (JSON: {Dashboard:"Dashboard Full Name"} and calls abovementioned method.

Method.name: GetDashboardList
Method.Description: Returns JSON array of (title, path) for all dashboards in namespace (accessible to current user).

Method.name: WriteDrillthroughJSON
Method.Description:
Wrapper for ##class(MDX2JSON.Utils).WriteDrillthroughJSON(pMDX).
Converts incoming request object and calls abovementioned method.

Method.name: WriteJSONfromMDXURL
Method.Implementation: set MDX = $ZCONVERT($ZCONVERT(MDX ,"I","URL") ,"I","UTF8") set st = ##class(MDX2JSON.Utils).WriteJSONfromMDX(MDX) quit st

Method.name: WriteFiltersForMDX
Method.Implementation: set MDX = $ZCONVERT($ZCONVERT(MDX ,"I","URL") ,"I","UTF8") set st = ##class(MDX2JSON.Utils).WriteFiltersForMDX(MDX) quit st

Method.name: WriteFiltersForCube
Method.Implementation: set Cube = $ZCONVERT($ZCONVERT(Cube ,"I","URL") ,"I","UTF8") set st = ##class(MDX2JSON.Utils).WriteFiltersForCube(Cube) quit st

Method.name: WriteFilterValuesForCube
Method.Implementation:
set Cube = %request.Content.Cube set Values = %request.Content.Values
set st = ##class(MDX2JSON.Utils).WriteFiltersForCube(Cube,Values) return st

Method.name: WriteFilterValues
Method.Implementation: set Cube = $ZCONVERT($ZCONVERT(Cube ,"I","URL") ,"I","UTF8") set Filter = $ZCONVERT($ZCONVERT(Filter ,"I","URL") ,"I","UTF8") set st = ##class(MDX2JSON.Utils).WriteFilterValues(Cube, Filter) quit st

Method.name: WriteJSONfromMDX
Method.Description:
Wrapper for ##class(MDX2JSON.Utils).WriteJSONPfromMDX(pMDX)
Converts incoming request object and calls abovementioned method.

Method.name: WriteJSONPfromMDX
Method.Description:
Wrapper for ##class(MDX2JSON.Utils).WriteJSONPfromMDX(pMDX)
Converts incoming request object and calls abovementioned method.

Method.name: WriteXMLAfromMDX
Method.Description:
Wrapper for ##class(MDX2JSON.Utils).WriteXMLAfromMDX(pMDX)
Converts incoming request object and calls abovementioned method.
